title: Ultimate Twice-Baked Potatoes Recipe
description: These twice-baked potatoes are full of cheesy goodness. The potatoes are topped with crispy bacon and green onion for the ultimate comfort food!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Potato Twice Baked Potato Recipes Ultimate Twice-Baked Potatoes 4.7 (3,754) 2,625 Reviews 394 Photos These twice-baked potatoes taste wonderful and always a big hit! I've been making these for years — they make a great side dish for any meal and are terrific heated up the next day for lunch. Submitted by PONYGIRL64 Updated on May 22, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 394 394 394 394 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 15 mins Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Dotdash Meredith Food Studios These twice-baked potatoes work perfectly as a simple, crowd-pleasing entrée or as a rich side dish. How to Make Twice-Baked Potatoes Making perfect twice-baked potatoes at home is easier than you think. You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: The Best Potatoes for Twice-Baked Potatoes The best potato variety for baking is low in moisture and high in starch, such as a Russet potato. Plus, they have sturdy skins (perfect for holding the rich filling) and are naturally perfectly portioned. How to Cook Twice-Baked Potatoes Here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this twice-baked potatoes recipe: Bake the potatoes until tender.Cook, drain, and crumble the bacon.Slice the potatoes and scoop out the flesh.Mix the flesh with the remaining ingredients (reserving half of the cheese and onions).Spoon the mixture back into the skins. Top with reserved ingredients and bacon.Bake the potatoes again for about 15 minutes. How Long to Cook Twice-Baked Potatoes All in all, the potatoes should spend about 1 hour and 15 minutes baking in an oven preheated to 350 degrees F. They'll cook for about an hour during the first round of baking, then about 15 minutes during the final round. Allrecipes Magazine How to Store Twice-Baked Potatoes Store leftover twice-baked potatoes tightly covered with plastic wrap or foil (or in an airtight storage container) in the fridge for up to four days. How to Reheat Twice-Baked Potatoes Reheat by baking the potatoes in an oven preheated to 350 degree F for 15 to 20 minutes or in the microwave (covered with a damp paper towel) for 2 to 3 minutes. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "I added a tablespoon of ranch seasoning powder (the same stuff you mix in sour cream for dip)," says Star. "Not overpowering but just enough to kick it up a notch." "This recipe is perfect," raves Patricia. "I used heavy cream in place of the milk. It was delicious! A hit with our dinner guests and we make it regularly when potatoes are on the menu." "The best of basic ingredients," according to eb. "Love it! High altitude takes longer. Those at high altitude understand. Totally worth the wait!!" Editorial contributions by Corey Williams. Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 4 large baking potatoes 8 slices bacon 1 cup sour cream ½ cup milk 4 tablespoons butter ½ teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon pepper 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, divided 8 green onions, sliced, divided Directions Gather ingredients and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake potatoes in the preheated oven until tender, about 1 hour, depending on the size of your potatoes. Set potatoes aside until cool enough to handle. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Meanwhile, place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble, and set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Slice potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop the flesh into a large bowl; save skins. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add sour cream, milk, butter, salt, pepper, 1/2 cup cheese, and 1/2 of the green onions to the potato; mix with a hand mixer until well blended and creamy. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spoon the mixture into the potato skins; top each with remaining cheese, green onions, and bacon. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Return potatoes to the preheated oven and continue baking until the cheese is melted, about 15 minutes. Serve Hot! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 5,144 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Ultimate Twice-Baked Potatoes 01 of 394 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 394 Photo by  Blaine Dee Jeffrey 04/09/2025 Easy to follow Worth the effort A keeper! Easy peasy. I used all ingredients. But didn’t have bacon. I added some spice such as jalapeños bits, seriously sharp cheese, little diced red onion along with the green onions. I like kicking it up. Oh, and a little bit of deli ham. (Just to finish it before it went bad). All turned out great.I’ll give the original a 6 out of 5 because of ease, good start on ingredients. Always dbl check the flesh for heat. I used a temp checker to make sure. Cause my potatoes were from the day before. That’s all that’s left. I forgot to take photo….😩 03 of 394 Photo by  Beth Sills 02/20/2024 A keeper! Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Easy and they turned out perfect! And super great taste! Son and Husband Loved them! 04 of 394 Photo by  TackySoup9213 02/14/2024 Tasted great. Don’t know why everyone is fussing with cooking times though. I microwaved my potatoes after poking holes in them and wrapping in cling wrap, 5 minutes flip over 5 min. Let sit to cool and they were tender and easily scoopable. This whole thing took me like 30 min tops. 05 of 394 Photo by  Tici Renee Truly 01/21/2024 I made a half batch. I was just about out of cream cheese and sour cream so I filled a half cup measuring cup with all I had and added ranch dip to make half a cup. I didn't have any milk so I used whipping cream. I left the bacon off my half potato because I'm a vegetarian. The potato was cooked in an hour at 350 so I didn't have the undercooked potato problems that some of the reviews had. It was delicious! 06 of 394 Photo by  PKC303 01/11/2024 Followed the recipe, but added 30 min. As indicated in reviews. Did add cream cheese, as well as the cheddar cheese. Will make again. Very tasty. 07 of 394 Photo by  Bruce Tate 11/18/2023 Ready to go in freezer for thanksgiving. 08 of 394 Photo by  Shyla 09/20/2023 I have used many recipes for twice baked potatoes over the years, but this one is the best I've ever used.I salted and peppered and added a little bit of garlic powder to the Shell of the potato.I used a jack cheese and cheddar cheese mix and green onion and bacon within the potato mixture to add to the flavor.I topped the potato with green onions and bacon before it's final 15 minutes in the oven. I omitted the cheese on top so that it would reduce the lactose for my family that has issues with that.It came out amazing. Although you can't tell by the picture, there were five half potatoes side by side and one half on the end.After they were cooled and ready to plate they came out perfectly as expected.The family ate every bit of the potato, even the skins. 09 of 394 Photo by  CozyStir4736 07/31/2023 People liked but I was disappointed with the consistency of the filling. Next time would cut down the milk to 1/4 c and sour cream to 3/4 c and 2 tbsp of butter. I even used six potatoes instead of the 4 called for. 10 of 394 Photo by  queenandrea1988 05/17/2023 I used 2 baked potatoes. 1 big for husband and 1 little one for me. I baked it in foil for about 2 hours at 400° and then I put shredded colby jack cheese, McCormick's Bacon Pieces bits sour cream, milk and 2 green onions sliced for about 20 minutes to bake with our T-bone steak🥩 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Great Twice Baked Potatoes 102 Ratings Buffalo Chicken Twice-Baked Potatoes 14 Ratings Easy Twice-Baked Potato Casserole 7 Ratings Healthier Ultimate Twice-Baked Potatoes 13 Ratings Twice Baked Potatoes I 224 Ratings Twice-Baked Potatoes for the Freezer 5 Ratings Twice-Baked Cheesy Potato Casserole 14 Ratings Twice-Baked Mashed Potatoes 28 Ratings Amazing Twice-Baked Mashed Potato Casserole 2 Ratings Loaded Baked Potato 7 Ratings Irish Stuffed Baked Potato 12 Ratings Creamy Twice-Baked Potatoes 53 Ratings Skewered Grilled Potatoes 156 Ratings Chef John's Twice-Baked Potatoes 234 Ratings Twice-Baked Potato Casserole 346 Ratings Twice Baked Cheesy Potatoes 62 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. instructions: Bake the potatoes until tender.;Cook, drain, and crumble the bacon.;Slice the potatoes and scoop out the flesh.;Mix the flesh with the remaining ingredients (reserving half of the cheese and onions).;Spoon the mixture back into the skins. Top with reserved ingredients and bacon.;Bake the potatoes again for about 15 minutes.;Gather ingredients and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake potatoes in the preheated oven until tender, about 1 hour, depending on the size of your potatoes. Set potatoes aside until cool enough to handle. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Meanwhile, place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble, and set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Slice potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop the flesh into a large bowl; save skins. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Add sour cream, milk, butter, salt, pepper, 1/2 cup cheese, and 1/2 of the green onions to the potato; mix with a hand mixer until well blended and creamy. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Spoon the mixture into the potato skins; top each with remaining cheese, green onions, and bacon. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Return potatoes to the preheated oven and continue baking until the cheese is melted, about 15 minutes. Serve Hot! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
